vulnerabilities.title: Backstage has a Possible Symlink Path Traversal in Scaffolder Actions
vulnerabilities.description:
### Impact

Multiple Scaffolder actions and archive extraction utilities were vulnerable to symlink-based path traversal attacks. An attacker with access to create and execute Scaffolder templates could exploit symlinks to:

1. **Read arbitrary files** via the `debug:log` action by creating a symlink pointing to sensitive files (e.g., `/etc/passwd`, configuration files, secrets)

vulnerabilities.title: Template Secret leakage in logs in Scaffolder when using `fetch:template`
vulnerabilities.description:
A logging flaw in Backstage Scaffolderâ€™s `fetch:template` action up to `@backstage/plugin-scaffolder-backend` **2.1.0** may write template secrets to logs. The action emitted a duplicate, pre-redaction copy of input parameters, so values provided via the `{{ secrets }}` bag could appear in local/server logs when the action ran. vulnerabilities.title: Backstage Scaffolder plugin has insecure sandbox
vulnerabilities.description:
The Backstage scaffolder-backend plugin uses a templating library that requires a sandbox, as it by design allows for code injection. The library used for this sandbox so far has been `vm2`, but in light of several past vulnerabilities and existing vulnerabilities  that may not have a fix, the plugin has switched to using a different sandbox library.

vulnerabilities.title: Path Traversal in @backstage/plugin-scaffolder-backend
vulnerabilities.description:
### Impact
A malicious actor with write access to a registered scaffolder template is able to manipulate the template in a way that writes files to arbitrary paths on the scaffolder-backend host instance.

vulnerabilities.title: Path Traversal in @backstage/plugin-scaffolder-backend
vulnerabilities.description:
### Impact

A malicious actor could read sensitive files from the environment where Scaffolder tasks are run. The attack is executed by crafting a custom Scaffolder template with a `publish:github:pull-request` action using a particular source path. When the template is executed the sensitive files would be included in the published pull request.

vulnerabilities.title: RCE vulnerability affecting v1beta3 templates in @backstage/plugin-scaffolder-backend
vulnerabilities.description:
